abstract: Comments filed with the Commerce Department highlighted concerns, including the dollar’s rising value, high tariffs and traveling difficulties.
snippet: Comments filed with the Commerce Department highlighted concerns, including the dollar’s rising value, high tariffs and traveling difficulties.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  When President Obama announced at his State of the Union address in January a goal of doubling American exports over five years, business owners applauded, envisioning a flood of goods moving into new markets in the Asian and Latin American countries that are leading the global recovery. The chief executives of Boeing and Xerox agreed to lead an advisory council to support the effort, called the National Export Initiative.

headline.main: Hurdles Deter Obama’s Pledge to Double Exports
